  • Method Details

    • pressCalc

      void pressCalc(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Method that is called when the "Calculate" button is pressed on the GUI. Also contains the code to convert from one base to the other and prints the output to the output field.
      Parameters:
      event - Default parameter that is never used in this function

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Updates the current value of the sliders in the text fields next to them when the user is interacting with them.

    • lettersToNums

      public ArrayList<Integer> lettersToNums(String input, int size, Integer base)
      If the input has letters in it. This method converts those letters to their respective values to make conversion easier and also checks to see if the input uses any invalid characters and ignores them if there are some.
      Parameters:
      input - String from the input text field.
      size - Size of the input string to ensure the while loop goes over every value in the string.
      base - The base of the input to check which values can and cannot be used.
      Returns:
      Returns an ArrayList of integers that the calculator will use during conversion.

    • numToLetters

      public String numToLetters(ArrayList<Integer> inputList)
      Used to convert values above 9 to their respective letter values for bases above base 10. This method goes through the whole ArrayList passed in and converts values accordingly.
      Parameters:
      inputList - ArrayList of integers passed in from the conversion algorithm.
      Returns:
      Returns the formatted string that will be sent to the output text field.
